conclusion: Acceleration is defined as the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, and the slope of the velocity-time graph represents acceleration.
If the slope of the velocity-time graph is positive, the acceleration is in the same direction as the velocity; if negative, the acceleration is in the opposite direction.
At t = 0, the velocity is v = 0 m/s.
From t = 0 to t = 10 seconds, the velocity increases steadily, reaching v = 20 m/s at t = 10 seconds.
The slope of the velocity-time graph is positive throughout the interval from 0 to 10 seconds, indicating that the velocity is increasing.
Since the velocity is increasing and the slope of the graph is positive, the acceleration is positive during this time.
The acceleration is directed downward, which is the same direction as the skydiver's motion (toward the ground), consistent with the force of gravity.
The direction of the acceleration during the interval from 0 to 10 seconds is downward.
